title: A step towards more inclusive access to information on living heritage
content: The UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage website has introduced a new accessibility feature to empower persons with disabilities and users with special needs to better navigate and engage with its content.…

title: Nine African countries engage in capacity building to safeguard living heritage and prepare nominations to the 2003 Convention’s Lists
content: Nine African countries have engaged in capacity-building workshops to prepare nominations to the Lists of the 2003 Convention and strengthen synergies among culture conventions, as part of the project ‘Building capacities for safeguarding living heritage and preparing nominations to the Lists of the …

title: Sharing insights and outcomes: hands-on workshops on living heritage and sustainable urban development in Latin America and the Caribbean
content: On 20 October, multi-sectoral teams from nine Central American countries met online to share results of a capacity-building programme on integrating living heritage into urban planning.…

title: UNESCO and Ukraine scaling up the teaching and learning with living heritage methodology in schools
content: The project ‘Supporting the resilience of Ukrainian school children through enhancing awareness of their living heritage’ is scaling up at the country level, with its second phase officially launched on 16 September 2025.…

title: Thirteenth annual coordination meeting of category 2 centres active in the field of intangible cultural heritage
content: The Category 2 Centres active in the field of intangible cultural heritage gathered online on 16 July 2025 for their thirteenth annual coordination meeting. They shared updates on recent activities and upcoming plans, and reflected, among others, on how to enhance their role in support of the periodic …

title: The Republic of Sierra Leone joined the 2003 Convention
content: The Republic of Sierra Leone is becoming the 185th State to join the 2003 Convention for the Safeguarding of the Intangible Cultural Heritage, having deposited its instrument of ratification with UNESCO on 19 June 2025.…

title: Experts reflect on safeguarding intangible cultural heritage in urban contexts

title: Caribbean Small Island Developing States exchange experiences on preparing nominations
content: Participants from 16 Caribbean Small Island Developing States and territories gathered online on 12 June 2025 to deepen collaboration, share lessons learned, and explore strategies for preparing nomination files to the Lists of the 2003 Convention.…
